com.colinalworth.celltable.columns.client
Interface Columns<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of data that will be rendered in the CellTable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ColumnsWithFactory<T,F>
public interface Columns<T>

Simplifies creation of Column objects for a CellTable. Interfaces extending this may be declared and requested using GWT.create, and used to add columns to the CellTable. Declared methods should return a type which implements Cell, and may be named for the properties available in the data to be drawn by the CellTable instance. As with the Editor framework and its implementors, these methods may be named as desired, with a Editor.Path annotation declaring how the data may be accessed. Again, as with Editor, the path provided may be blank, indicating the row itself, or may reference nested properties. Cell instances will be created through the use of GWT.create, allowing for replacement or generation. If you wish to provide your own implementation, either create the Column object manually, or see ColumnsWithFactory for a way to provide a factory instance. Once a Cell has been created, either by calling the declared methods directly, or by calling configure(...), it will be retained, so that subsequent calls will get the same instance. At this time there is no support for getting access to the Column instances. Further extending a subinterface of Columns to add more columns is not supported at this time.

Author:
Colin Alworth

Nested Class Summary
static interface Columns.Alignment
          Sets the alignment of the Column, as would be done using setVerticalAlignment and setHorizontalAlignment.
static interface Columns.ConvertedWith
          Allows a type implementing DataConverter to be provided which will accept data from the get method this Column is mapped to and transform it before passing it the Cell instance and back again.
static interface Columns.Editable
          Marks the Column as Editable, so a FieldUpdater will be created and used to call the matching set method for the property this column is assigned to.
static interface Columns.Header
          Sets a static string to be used as the header of the column to be generated.
static interface Columns.Sortable
          Indicates that the Column should be set as sortable for the client.
 
Method Summary
 void configure(com.google.gwt.user.cellview.client.CellTable<T> cellTable)
          Adds each of the Cells to the given table, wrapped in a Column with the options specified configured on them.

 String[] getPaths()
          As in the Editor Driver classes, returns the property names that are accessed by this instance.
 

Method Detail

configure

void configure(com.google.gwt.user.cellview.client.CellTable<T> cellTable)
Adds each of the Cells to the given table, wrapped in a Column with the options specified configured on them. Columns are added in the order they are declared.

Parameters:
cellTable -

configure

void configure(com.google.gwt.user.cellview.client.CellTable<T> cellTable,
               HasDataFlushableEditor<T> editor)
As configure(CellTable), except will also bind the columns to the editor, so that when the editor system flushes, the data will be applied to the model. Because data will not be applied to the model until the flush occurs, some data can be somewhat inconsistent - the Cells will need to track their changed data correctly until the data is flushed, and other cells won't be able to get the updated value until then. TODO Consider adding a configuration option to allow immediate flushing (other than not passing an editor)

Parameters:
cellTable -
editor -

getPaths

String[] getPaths()
As in the Editor Driver classes, returns the property names that are accessed by this instance. At this time, primitive properties are returned, unlike in the Driver classes, and nested properties may be returned in an inconsistent manner.

Returns:
